Spoofing.cwe_description: Improper Authentication. The system fails to correctly authenticate an entity.

tids.tid_description: Remote service accessible without authentication, allowing identity spoofing.
Hard-coded credentials embedded in firmware enabling attacker impersonation.

Tampering.cwe_description: Improper Control of Hardware Security Features. Fault injection can alter execution flow.

tids.tid_description: Voltage or clock glitching used to bypass secure boot or authentication checks.

Tampering.cwe_description: Protection Mechanism Failure. Security controls are missing or ineffective.

tids.tid_description: Bootloader modification due to missing integrity verification.

Information Disclosure.cwe_description: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data. Data is stored or transmitted in cleartext.

tids.tid_description: Interception of internal data bus revealing sensitive information.
Extraction of secrets from ROM or NVRAM due to lack of encryption.

Information Disclosure.cwe_description: Improper Protection of Physical Side Channels.

tids.tid_description: Power consumption analysis used to extract cryptographic keys.
Electromagnetic analysis leaking sensitive computation data.

Denial of Service.cwe_description: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption leading to service unavailability.

tids.tid_description: Flooding of service requests causing ECU resource exhaustion.

Elevation of Privilege.cwe_description: On-Chip Debug and Test Interface With Improper Access Control.

tids.tid_description: Unauthorized access via JTAG or SWD interface.
Latent debug port enabling memory or code manipulation.
